title: rustdoc source pages hang Android Chrome for a significant period while loading

labels.name: I-slow
labels.description: Problems and improvements with respect to performance of generated code.

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
It's actually gotten better recently, in that smaller source pages sometimes work (up to ~500 source lines I've seen work) but it's still a noticeable issue that hits me whenever I hit the source link.

I've reported this via the [Chrome "Send Feedback"](https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95315?co=GENIE.Platform%3DAndroid&oco=1) link, but I don't think that creates anything trackable by the public.

From clicking the source link on [the `core::sync::atomic` page](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/core/sync/atomic/index.html):

- Instant: Page appears to load.
- ~2s: Chrome freezes.
- ~22s: "Chrome is not responding" popup.
- 5m: I gave up on this trial and aborted. Chrome was still frozen and unusable, forcing a force-stop to make Chrome usable again.

This is extra fun, because when reopening Chrome, it opens the page, requiring a fast-action "back" action to avoid re-freezing.

This is repeatable, and I reproduced twice. Obviously the 5 minutes of waiting to see if it starts responding makes more trials a bit hard 🙃

For an easier test, [the `core` page](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/std/index.html):

- Instant: Page appears to load.
- ~1s: Chrome freezes.
- ~12s: "Chrome is not responding" popup.
- ~15s: Page is responsive.

#### System information

```
Chrome 100.0.4896.127
Android 12; Pixel 4 XL Build/SP2A.220405.003
```
